careTargets.gradient: Horizontal gradient with basking area at 85°F, ambient 75-80°F, and cool side at 70-72°F

lifespan: 12-16 years in captivity, up to 20+ years with excellent care
notes: Known for their docile temperament and 'smiling' appearance
Nocturnal and crepuscular - active during dawn/dusk and throughout the night; rest in cool dark spots during day
Can become obese in captivity - monitor feeding carefully and provide dietary variety
Prefer horizontal perches over vertical climbing; rest on leaves and branches
Males vocalize loudly during breeding season (Nov-Feb in wild) - calls intensify after rain
More tolerant of handling than most tree frogs; gentle squeezing motions when stressed

warnings.message: Obesity is the #1 health issue - do not overfeed. Feed 2-3 appropriately-sized insects every 2-3 days, varying feeder insects (crickets, roaches, moths) for nutritional diversity. Dust with calcium 2-3x weekly
Use dechlorinated water only - tap water chlorine/chloramine can cause skin irritation and respiratory issues. Fireflies are poisonous to frogs - never use as feeders
Beginners: This species is more forgiving of humidity fluctuations and handling than other tree frogs, making them ideal first reptile pets
Screen enclosures are not recommended - they lose humidity too quickly and frogs can damage their noses rubbing against screen. Use glass or PVC with proper ventilation instead
